titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vassar College Drama Department Records, circa 1910-2008
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Laura Streett

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Elizabeth Clarke April 2007

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Material documenting the history of the Vassar College Drama Department and its many components and programs (including the Experimental Theatre). Includes programs, news clippings, production material, photographs, negatives, slides, and film.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Vassar College Experimental Theatre was founded in 1925 by Hallie Flanagan Davis as a program of the English Department, and later became part of the Drama Department when it was founded in 1938. The predecessors of the Experimental Theatre included the Vassar Dramatic Workshop and the Vassar Players.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Programs, news clippings, production material, photographs, slides, and negatives documenting the history of the Vassar College Drama Department and its many components and programs (including the Experimental Theatre) from about 1905-2017.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 48 contains restricted material. Please contact the Archives and Special Collections staff for more information. The rest of the collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

controlaccess.head: VCL Categories:
controlaccess.subject: Vassar College Academic Departments and Programs

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Original encoding by Elizabeth Clarke, April 2007. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, October 2025.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed April 2005 by Laura Streett. Updated in 2018 by Janine St. Germaine (added boxes 62-83).
Production files from 1980-1993 (A2020-003 and A2024-027) were integrated into Boxes 52-58.
Remainder of files from A2024-027 were added to Boxes 84-.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The records of Martin Fallon, technician and then an instructor in stage management for the Drama Department from approximately 1936-1944, were added to the collection in 2010, a gift of Charles D. Fallon (A2010-009).
The 2011 accession included photographs presumed to have been taken by Raymon Traver.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Vassar College Drama Department Records, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

scopecontent.p: Programs, news clippings, promotional material, and other records relating to the the Experimental Theatre and its productions as well as miscellaneous Drama Department files.

did.unittitle: Series II. Miscellaneous Student Papers and Theses,

scopecontent.p: An incomplete set of student papers completed for various Drama Department classes.
*Please note: Some Drama Department theses have been cataloged separately and can be accessed via the Vassar College Libraries Online Catalog.

did.unittitle: Series III. Experimental Theatre Lantern Slides,

scopecontent.p: Two sets of slides used in the Experimental Theatre productions, Can You Hear Their Voices (1931) and One-Third of a Nation (1937).
Mostly 4"x5" negatives on cellulose acetate "Safety" film. Some are deteriorating and/or brittle and may not be available for duplication.
Photographs housed according to size, then in chronological order.
Boxes 10-21 and 68-79 contain 8" x 10" and smaller photographs
Boxes 4-5 contain 14" x 18" and smaller photographs
Items housed in map cases are approximately 12" x 48"
Only some of the photos in Box 25 are signed by Raymon Traver, but it is possible that all of them were taken by him.
There are additional photographs in the production files housed in boxes 59 and 60 (A2013-025).
4 slide boxes within a larger box. Includes "Coursework, 1905-1981" and a set of numbered slides (with some numbers missing) of productions dating from 1944-1960.

did.unittitle: Series VII. Drama Department Audio and Film Reels,

scopecontent.p: A small set of film and audio reals from miscellaneous productions.

did.unittitle: Series VIII. Drama Department Production Material,

scopecontent.p: Scripts, prompt books, costume and set design, etc. including Experimental Theatre productions, Hall productions, senior theses*, and class projects. Organized in chronological order, but not listed by individual production. There is also a small collection of musical scores as well as the state management records of Martin Fallon. Boxes 59 and 60 also include programs, correspondence, photographs and other materials relating to productions dating from 1915-1949.
*Please note: Some Drama Department theses have been cataloged separately and can be accessed via the Vassar College Libraries Online Catalog.
